snippet: Mr. Andreotti, who epitomized postwar Italy’s contradictions, helped usher the country into wealth but also played a part in the spread of cronyism.
abstract: Giulio Andreotti, a seven-time prime minister of Italy with a resume of both accomplishments and failings that reads like a history of the republic itself, dies at age 94.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Andreotti, who epitomized postwar Italy’s contradictions, helped usher the country into wealth but also played a part in the spread of cronyism.

headline.seo: Giulio Andreotti, Premier of Italy 7 Times, Dies at 94
headline.main: Giulio Andreotti, Premier of Italy 7 Times, Dies at 94
headline.print_headline: Giulio Andreotti, Who Served as Prime Minister of Italy 7 Times, Dies at 94
